content: deta s bookmark ©torunjohansson suggested materials scheepjes maxi sweet treat bonbon hook 1 25mm 1 50mm depending on desired look i used 1 25 in these pictures standard american terms st = stitch slip_stitch = slip_stitch chain = chain double_crochet = double_crochet skip = skip chain space = chain space ch3-space = chain 3 space rem = remaining note when the instructions say to work a stitch into a chain space it is your choice whether you prefer to crochet around the chains or into them i prefer to crochet around the chains to begin make a foundation chain of 23 r1 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook double_crochet in rem 19 chain =21dc turn r2 chain 4 skip first st double_crochet in next st *chain 1 skip st double_crochet in next st* repeat * to* 8 more times turn r3 chain 3 *double_crochet in chain space double_crochet in next st* repeat *to* 9 more times =21dc turn r4 chain 3 double_crochet in following 8 st chain 3 skip 3 st double_crochet in rem 9 st turn r5 chain 3 double_crochet in following 5 st chain 5 slip_stitch into ch3-space chain 5 skip next 3 st double_crochet in rem 6 st turn r6 ch3 double_crochet in next 2 st chain 5 slip_stitch into first ch5-space chain 5 slip_stitch into next ch5-space chain 5 skip next 3 st double_crochet in rem 3 st turn r7 chain 3 double_crochet into next 2 st 3 double_crochet into first ch5-space chain 5 slip_stitch into the middle ch5-space chain 5 3 double_crochet into the third ch5-space double_crochet in rem 3 st when you work the dcs into the chain space you might need to scooch them into place see photo turn r8 chain 3 double_crochet into next 5 st 3 double_crochet into ch5-space chain 3 3 double_crochet into ch5-space double_crochet in rem 6 st turn r9 chain 3 double_crochet in next 8 st 3 double_crochet into ch3-space double_crochet in rem 9 st =21dc turn repeat row 2-9 until you reach desired length final row repeat r2 finishing touches add a fringe at the bottom you might need to block it 1 chart slip_stitch chain double_crochet this pattern was designed and written by torun johansson you may use it freely but please credit me as the designer i would appreciate a link back to me any time you share either photos or the pattern of deta s bookmark please link either to my ravelry shop or using the hashtag #detasbookmark should you find a mistake in the pattern please let me know happy
